general: This act allows doctors and other healthcare professionals to continue their work in approving medical treatments for people with mental health issues, even if they were not officially approved before the act was passed. It makes sure that the doctors and others can keep doing their jobs without any problems or legal issues.

series.short: "Legal Validation of Pre-Act Approvals and Application Across UK Nations."
series.text:
* Simplified point 1: The act ensures that any actions taken by individuals in the exercise of approval functions before the passage of the act are validated and recognized as legal.
* Simplified point 2: The act applies to England, Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland.
* Simplified point 3: The act gives power to individuals to give approvals for medical recommendations and to approve persons as approved clinicians under the Mental Health Act 1983.

summary: The Mental Health (Approval Functions) Act 2012 ensures that actions taken before its passing are still considered legal. This law applies across the UK - England, Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland. It allows certain individuals to make decisions about medical recommendations and approve professionals as qualified mental health experts under the Mental Health Act 1983. In other words, this law helps ensure that only trained and skilled professionals can provide treatment for those with mental health issues.
single:
•	This act authorizes actions taken before it was passed, in the purported exercise of approval functions under the Mental Health Act 1983.
•	Approval functions include the function of giving an approval for the purposes of section 12 of the Mental Health Act 1983 (practitioners approved to give medical recommendations), or the function of approving a person as an approved clinician for the purposes of that Act.
•	The act comes into force on the day it is passed.
•	The act extends to England and Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland.
•	The act may be cited as the Mental Health (Approval Functions) Act 2012.
•	The act simplifies and clarifies the approval functions under the Mental Health Act 1983, ensuring that actions taken before the act was passed are valid and legal.
•	The act has no significant impact on the general public, but rather focuses on ensuring the legal validity of actions taken by medical practitioners and clinicians under the Mental Health Act 1983.
